question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: calculate_current_index()] [Timestamp Manipulation] If clock::timestamp_ms can be manipulated or if clock is stale, can attacker make timestamp_difference artificially large to accrue excessive interest? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: calculate_current_index()] [Division by 1000] At line 269, timestamp difference is converted from milliseconds to seconds by dividing by 1000 - can precision loss occur for sub-second interest calculations? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: calculate_current_index()] [Compounded Interest Overflow] When c::calculate_compounded_interest is called at lines 272-275, can extremely large timestamp_difference cause interest to overflow? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: calculate_current_index()] [Linear Interest Overflow] Similarly, at lines 279-282 for linear interest calculation, can large time periods cause overflow in supply index? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: calculate_current_index()] [Ray Mul Overflow] At line 276, ray_math::ray_mul(compounded_interest, current_borrow_index) - can this overflow if both values are large? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: calculate_current_index()] [Ray Mul Overflow Supply] At line 283, ray_math::ray_mul(linear_interest, current_supply_index) - can this overflow for long time periods with high rates? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: calculate_current_index()] [Zero Rate Edge Case] If current_borrow_rate or current_supply_rate is 0, do the interest calculations handle this correctly or can they return incorrect indices? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: calculate_current_index()] [Index Initialization] If storage::get_index returns (0, 0) for a new asset, will ray_mul operations fail or produce garbage values? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: calculate_current_index()] [Timestamp Stale] If last_update_timestamp is very old and current time is much newer, can timestamp_difference be so large it breaks interest calculations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: calculate_current_index()] [Rate Retrieval] If storage::get_current_rate returns stale or incorrect rates, all index calculations will be wrong - can this be exploited via storage manipulation? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: calculate_current_index()] [Index Divergence] If borrow and supply indices diverge significantly due to different interest calculation methods (compounded vs linear), can this cause accounting issues? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: calculate_current_index()] [U64 to U256 Cast] At line 269, last_update_timestamp is cast from u64 to u256 - can this cause issues if timestamp is near u64::MAX? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_apy()] [Assertion Bypass] At line 297, the same assertion as dynamic_health_factor prevents both estimates being > 0 - can this block legitimate APY estimation for simultaneous supply/borrow? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_apy()] [Normal Amount Conversion] When pool::normal_amount is called at lines 305 and 310, can this conversion introduce errors that make APY calculations inaccurate? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_apy()] [Rate Calculation Order] Borrow rate is calculated first (lines 313-320), then supply rate depends on it (lines 322-330) - can this dependency be exploited to manipulate APY? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_apy()] [U64 to U256 Cast] Estimates are cast from u64 to u256 multiple times - can loss of precision or overflow occur in these conversions? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_apy()] [Type Mismatch] Pool is typed Pool<CoinType> but asset is u8 - can there be a mismatch between the pool type and asset being estimated? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_apy()] [Zero Estimate Values] If both estimate values are 0, the function still calculates rates - should it short-circuit to save gas? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_borrow_rate()] [Rate Model Parameters] If storage::get_borrow_rate_factors returns incorrect parameters (base_rate, multiplier, jump_rate_multiplier, optimal_utilization), can protocol or users be exploited? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_borrow_rate()] [Utilization Calculation] The utilization from dynamic_caculate_utilization at line 345 is critical - can manipulated utilization cause incorrect rate calculation? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_borrow_rate()] [Optimal Utilization Threshold] At line 347, if utilization equals optimal_utilization exactly, which branch is taken - can this boundary case be exploited? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_borrow_rate()] [Jump Rate Addition] At line 350, the formula is base_rate + ray_mul(utilization, multiplier) + ray_mul((utilization - optimal), jump_rate_multiplier) - can any of these operations overflow? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_borrow_rate()] [Utilization Underflow] At line 350, (utilization - optimal_utilization) assumes utilization >= optimal - but the check at 347 is <, so can this underflow if utilization == optimal? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_borrow_rate()] [Ray Mul Precision Loss] Multiple ray_mul operations at lines 348 and 350 - can precision loss accumulate to give incorrect rates? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_ui/sources/calculate.move] [Function: dynamic_calculate_borrow_rate()] [Rate Overflow] Can the sum of base_rate + ray_mul(...) + ray_mul(...) overflow u256 for extreme parameter values? (Medium)
